Package intlist

Class IntArray

java.lang.Object
intlist.IntArray
public class IntArray
extends java.lang.Object
Each instance of this class represents an array.
Invariants:
The length of the array is greater or equal to zero. 
0 <= getLength()

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    IntArray()
    Initialize an empty array

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void appendElement​(int element)
    Append an element to the end of the array
    int[] getArray()
    Return a copy of the internal array (otherwise does the client has access to the internal representation: representation exposure) - see '@creates'
    int getElement​(int index)
    Return the element at a given index of the array Contractual:
    int getLength()
    Return the length of the array
    int removeLastElement()

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • IntArray

      public IntArray()
      Initialize an empty array
      Postconditions:
      The length of the array equals zero 
      getLength() == 0

  • Method Details

    • getLength

      public int getLength()
      Return the length of the array
      Postconditions:
      result == getArray().length

    • getElement

      public int getElement​(int index)
      Return the element at a given index of the array Contractual:
      Preconditions:
      The given index should be greater or equal than zero 
      0 <= index
      The given index should be smaller than the length of the array 
      index < getLength()
      The length of the array should be greater than zero. 
      getLength() > 0
Defensive:
      Postconditions:
      result == getArray()[index]
// Note: no need to specify that no elements may be changed, since 'get' implies for FSC4J that it does not mutate objects.

    • setElement

      public void setElement​(int index, int value)
      Preconditions:
      0 <= index && index < getLength()
Defensive:
      Mutates:
      this
Contractual:
      Postconditions:
      getLength() == old(getLength())
      IntStream.range(0, getLength()).allMatch(i ->
	 	i == index ?
			getElement(i) == value
		: 
			getElement(i) == old(getArray())[i])
// statement ? true-value : false-value

    • getArray

      public int[] getArray()
      Return a copy of the internal array (otherwise does the client has access to the internal representation: representation exposure) - see '@creates'
      Basic inspector
      If a method uses a @mutates_properties clause to specify its effect, and some object O of this class is in the peer group of some object mentioned in the clause, and O.M() is not mentioned in the clause, where M is this method, then O.M remains unchanged.
      Creates:
      result

    • appendElement

      public void appendElement​(int element)
      Append an element to the end of the array
      Postconditions:
      The last element of the array equals the given argument 
      getElement(old(getLength())) == element
      The length of the array is increased by one 
      getLength() == old(getLength()) + 1
      The existing elements in the array are unchanged 
      IntStream.range(0, old(getLength())).allMatch(i ->
		getElement(i) == old(getArray())[i])
// IntStream.range(a, b).allMatch(i -> statement about i)		(inclusive a, exclusive b)
Alternative:
      Arrays.equals(getArray(), 0, getLength() - 1, old(getArray()), 0, old(getLength()))

    • removeLastElement

      public int removeLastElement()
      Remove the last element of the array Contractual:
      Preconditions:
      The length of the array is greater than zero 
      getLength() > 0
Defensive:
      Postconditions:
      The returned element was the last element of the array 
      result == old(getElement(old(getLength()) - 1))
      The length of the array is reduced by one 
      1 + getLength() == old(getLength())
      The other existing elements in the array are unchanged 
      IntStream.range(0, getLength() - 1).allMatch(i ->
		getElement(i) == old(getArray())[i])
